Interface iPlanche

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
Planche
public interface iPlanche extends Serializable
The planche class handles the movement of the player on the board.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    checkLapped(Player p)
     
    Player
    getPlayerAt(int position)
    Given a cell number, finds if there are any players at the corrisponding cell on the board.
    int
    getPlayerPosition(Player p)
    Returns the current position on the planche of a player.
    void
    loseGame(Player p)
     
    void
    movePlayer(VoyageState state, Player p, int rel_change)
    Either moves the player forward or backwards by a number of steps equal to rel_change, skipping the players in between.

  • Method Details

    • getPlayerPosition

      int getPlayerPosition(Player p)
      Returns the current position on the planche of a player.
      Parameters:
      p - Player The player being searched.
      Returns:
      The position of the player being searched, or -1 if the player is not present.

    • getPlayerAt

      Player getPlayerAt(int position)
      Given a cell number, finds if there are any players at the corrisponding cell on the board.
      Parameters:
      position - Number of the cell to query.
      Returns:
      Player The player on the cell, or null if nobody occupies it.

    • movePlayer

      void movePlayer(VoyageState state, Player p, int rel_change)
      Either moves the player forward or backwards by a number of steps equal to rel_change, skipping the players in between.
      Parameters:
      state - VoyageState The state currently being played.
      p - Player The player being moved.
      rel_change - The number of steps the player has to move.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player being moved is not on the Planche.

    • checkLapped

      boolean checkLapped(Player p)

    • loseGame

      void loseGame(Player p)
